title: The Sting
description: Michael organizes a sting operation to find out the secrets of a rival paper company's salesman who is stealing Dunder Mifflin's clients, and Andy gets Darryl's help to form a band.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I love cycling. Andy, I feel like a tourist in my own city. I literally can't wait to wake up every morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She is a beaut!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can't beat a horse. A horse is a bike that peddles itself.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, look at that. [pushing bike]  Smooth roll.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You got it! Lance Armstrong's Bike!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: His ass was on that seat? All right!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, Meredith, that's not his actual bicycle, but it is the same exact model he uses.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm on Sheryl Crow's side in that whole thing, so I feel really weird right now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [crashing sound] Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, god!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I can ride a bike. I take spinning classes three times a month. I think I know how to ride a bike.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you sure you once knew how to do this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did, yes! I had those extra wheels on the back...that support you. [Pam and Jim begin wheeling him] Mi-chael! Mi-chael!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [chanting] Mi-chael! Mi-chael! Mi-chael! Mi-chael!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on, Michael! Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just steer more now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [crashes into Jim and Pam's parked car] Oh, my god!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not the car!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No! No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ow! [grunts, stumbles to his feet] You never forget. Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How do I look?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Amazing. How do I look?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Normal. Ugly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I do the best with what I've got. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright. Wait, wait, wait, wait for me! It's weird if I come in slightly after.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We have a big meeting with the chief buyer for Frames Select, Steve Nash.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's not the Steve Nash. He's big though. He's kind of like...Scranton's Steve Nash.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Will you stop trying to put it in terms you think they'll understand? It's condescending.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not doing that. I'm just explaining.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And who is this "the" Steve Nash?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Phoenix Sun's point guard?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No? Nothin'?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Mr. Jock Hipster.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I'm neither of those things, so...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [reading Cornell magazine] Whoa. Libby Dirketts got married. Big Red mazel tov to the Libster. Ooh, says here Dan Becker fell off the side of Kilimanjaro in a climbing accident. It appears Dan's Sherpa survived to tell the tale-Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What? Is Dan okay?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, he died. It's Broccoli Rob. You know this guy; I showed you his picture on Facebook.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: "Some Vermont-based alums can hear 'Broccoli' Rob Blatt, '96, in the state milk lobby's new milk awareness song, 'Calci-YUM!', featuring Phish's Trey Anastasio. Says Broccoli, 'Trey and I had a ton of fun in the studio, and I think you can hear it in the song.'"

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, that's great news for your friend.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah, it's great...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You know, I forget about milk. This is a terrific reminder.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was the artsy, musical one. In Here Comes Treble I had four solos, Broccoli rob had three. Right? Uhh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go tell her we're here. You're good with receptionists.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, ha ha ha. Dwight...[motions to lobby]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Crap.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Danny Cordray is the worst.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, by worst, you mean the best.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The best salesman ever. He works for Osprey Paper over in Throop, steals more clients from Dunder-Mifflin than anyone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, the situation is the worst.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Also, he slept with Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, he didn't. [Dwight mouthing "yes, he did"]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tell 'em.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing happened. We went on a couple of dates. He never called me again.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? He never called you? I thought you said it just fizzled.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's fizzling. I mean, someone has to start the fizzle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I thought you started it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I liked him. For a couple of days. Four years ago. [Jim nodding repeatedly] You know I have a kid with you, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ahhh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna intimidate him. Okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, great-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Watch this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: -I'm just gonna watch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [speaking loudly] So anyway, she says, "that is the biggest penis I have ever seen." And I said, "I know. That's why I brought you to the Penis Museum, where tickets are a thousand dollars." Well, hello Danny!

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight. Good to see you. Jim, hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [shaking hands] How are ya?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Good to see you too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Oh, I'm just here for the coffee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Like hell you are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's not just here for the coffee, Jim. Wake up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Brainstorming session is now open. Anyone has an idea-[cell phone rings] Hold on. Sorry, sorry, sorry. Hello?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, it's Jim. Listen, this is important. Are you busy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey. No, I'm not busy. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You are busy! We're in a meeting!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's Jim, Okay? Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Listen, you gotta get over here, 'cause we're pitching Steve Nash and Danny Cordray is here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You need the big guns, yes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What'd he say? What did he say?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The big gun thing. [Dwight grabs at phone] Stop!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will see you in ten. Bye! Hold tight. [hangs up] Well, I know a lot of you thought that my sales days were behind me, and to be honest, so did I...and the only reason I got out of the sales game was to be reluctantly called back in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You don't look reluctant, Michael. You look really eager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] No, I don't have time for this. Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You don't?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! Okay. [runs out the door] All right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [knocking] Knockity-knock, don't knock back. Just kidding you can knock; it's your office. Do you have a minute?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm very busy with time-sensitive work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not to go all Sherlock Holmes on you, but I can tell by the reflection in your glasses that you're entering points into Weight Watchers dot com.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If you don't enter them immediately, you forget. What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm starting a band and I need you on keyboards.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nah. I play for pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is for pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I wouldn't enjoy that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm willing to pay you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, yeah?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How much?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sixty bucks a session.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's crazy money. I'll take forty.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, that's a male model.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that's him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That...hello. Michael Scott, Dunder-Mifflin Paper Company.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Danny Cordray, Osprey Paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Three of you guys for one sale.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well...we call it overkill. Why am I telling you my strategy?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Well, whatever works for ya. Anyway. All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: It's good to see you guys. Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Buh-bye. I could swear that guy was a male model.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.text: He's ready for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thank you. All right. On the count of three, it's showtime. Ready, one, two-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, not doing that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've been in showtime mode since breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you know-all right, just forget it then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Showtime!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's showtime! Oh...never mind. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I knock on your door, you know who it is; it's Michael Scott. We've been together forever and we-

quotes.speaker: Steve
quotes.text: Michael, I appreciate everything that Dunder-Mifflin has done for this company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? You are having some problems with your loading dock, are you not? All right. We're going to deliver to you on weekends.

quotes.speaker: Steve
quotes.text: That's very generous, but-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And you know what else we're gonna do? I can't believe I'm gonna say this...we are going to offer you our paper at cost. I know. I could get in a lotta trouble for this, so you'd better shake my hand right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's not kidding.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shake it, shake it!

quotes.speaker: Steve
quotes.text: Michael, I'm going with Danny.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Steve
quotes.text: Thanks for coming in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Steve
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks, Steve.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim talked too much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I didn't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, you did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it. Just stop it. We did what we should have done, we just got bested. [pounds the elevator button] Why is there a door close button if it doesn't even close the door?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do I feel about losing the sale? It's like if Michael Phelps came out of retirement, jumped in the pool, belly-flopped, and drowned.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know who we always lose out to? Staples, the big guys. Osprey? They're a small company. They're smaller than we are. What's our excuse? How do we combat this guy? Stanley, how do we combat him?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We sell better?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. You know what? You clearly don't care, so why don't you just leave?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I would like to stay. This pertains to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't you go outside and...take a shot of insulin and have a nap, okay?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Why do you always assume I have diabetes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, your frame, your build-why don't you have a glass of apple juice and tell me you're not a diabetic. [Stanley stands to leave] See? I could tell by the sound you made when you stood up that you have-okay. Yes, Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I could try to seduce him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my god!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know how we can learn his tricks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What I am about to show you is of the utmost secrecy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that your office?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, Jim. And with a little tweaking, it becomes a different office. We lure Danny to it and watch him sell.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm outta here.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: This is weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what this is? This is a stinger.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like the movie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you mean The Sting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Paul Newman, Robert Redford. They're bank robbers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. Different movie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Sting. The Sting.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Your two o'clock. [Danny enters]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thanks, hun.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Meredith was the perfect choice to play the head of the company. Her lunch break lined up with our appointment with Danny and...that's it. That's really all we were looking for.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Danny Cordray. It's great to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Meredith Van Helsing. Pleased to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Meredith Van Helsing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Van Helsing was a respected professor before he was a vampire killer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. But what is he more famous for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhh! Hey! That's my mug.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know this isn't real TV, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: {Darryl} and {Andy}
quotes.text: [singing] Please Mr. President, if you wanna give hope a whirl, bring our troops home safe and sound, says this little girl.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in falsetto] Please Mr. President-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: One second, one second, one second. [stops playing] So, this song is from the point of view of a little girl?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: But you're singing it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, but I'm using my falsetto.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, that's not a good idea. I don't see that as a very good song.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, well, it'd sound a lot better if you actually sang with some soul.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, I never sing with soul.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's a lie.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I could sing it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just was hoping to maybe save your voice in case we did a novelty song about frogs.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But my voice is unique. Like Bob Dylan.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, three-way argument between a drummer, a keyboardist, and the front man lead singer. Wonder who's gonna win this one. Two, three, four-

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I'm gonna take off my coat, if you don't mind. It's a bit warm in here.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hel-lo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, no. No. Don't-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People can't keep their true natures hidden for long, and this guy is smoldering like a tire fire.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Testify.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, he's not that good-looking. I don't understand why everybody's obsessed with this-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, he is that good-looking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's very, very handsome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That's a great set of shoulder's you got there. What is that...Genetics? Creatine? [phone rings] Sorry. Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pull it together, all right? Stop lookin' at him.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'm sorry. [hangs up] You're here to sell me some paper.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Well, actually, uh... no, Miss Van Helsing, that's not why I'm here. I'm here to meet you, see if we'd be a, you know, good fit.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh...my god! He's making her sell to him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [everyone finishes listening to song] Okay. Honest feedback time. Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's pandering. And it makes me think you think I'm stupid.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But do you think it could be famous? Like in a car commercial or something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not really. It's kinda weird that a grown man is singing from the point of view of a little girl.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I feel like I can see someone ice skating to it. You know, like in the Olympics.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I-I don't think they usually...skate to such...bad songs.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Rude. And not helpful.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Well, I really, really, really liked it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, that...really bums me out.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: We should think of this as a first date. And I think it's going very well, how 'bout you?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Real well. Uh...feels more like a third date to me.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Ha ha, okay, there you go! [phone rings, Meredith answers]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stay-

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Shut up and let me do this! [hangs up] You know, what is with this desk keeping us so far apart?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I've never been a desk man. Always traveling on the road. Come on...why not, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Well, we'll get this...[Meredith unbuttons]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: So, what's your drink? You a vodka man? Me too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We gotta get someone else in there right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're an exec at Pennsylvania Solartech and-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That sounds fake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I told you! You're an exec at Stark Industries, a corporation you inherited from your father-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Will you stop? Stop it, stop it. Here's the story-they need Meredith somewhere else asap, okay?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So you're taking over. You just gotta get her out of there as soon as you can.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: All right. I can do that. Then what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then make him pitch to you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We gotta see what he's got.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Exactly. You can do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, and remember-you're not gay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop it! It's gonna be great.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And listen if anything else happens, just...roll with it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Meredith, I-

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, Manuel! This is Manuel, my cleaning man. He doesn't speak any English.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Hola. Que tal?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Como estas, senor?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Uh, Manuel, cleano el window.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who else we got?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. You're a young hotshot from Stark Industries. You've just bought this company. Meredith is fired. It's a whole new regime. He's gotta pitch to you now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay. Stark Industries isn't real. I run Google. Larry and Sergey brought me in-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. Sounds awesome. Just have him pitch to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't let us down.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [points to Jim] Will do. [points to Michael] Won't do.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Yeah, sure.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You smell like a Scorpio. [Ryan enters] This is...Esteban...another cleaning man. He doesn't speak English either. Esteban, el flooro.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: You know what? I may have parked my car in a compact space, and I hate when I see others do that, so-

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Danny, I feel a real connection to you, and I gotta get real, I'm-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no....

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, no...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm goin 'in!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! No, Michael, stop it! No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop, stop! Oh, my god! [enters office] Okay. Stop it, stop it, stop it. Gross! Stop it, please. Everybody, stop.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I said stop. Okay, Danny...this is not Pennsylvania Solartech. This is Dunder-Mifflin Paper Company. This is Meredith Palmer-

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Please to meet you-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't! Get away from him. Please, just leave. Get out of here. Go. Forever.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I owe you...a most sincere and humble apology. We were trying to watch you to see your sales technique, so we could stop losing so many clients to you.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: But from where?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A surveillance room next to this one.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Okay, so you...set up this fake company, then you hired this homeless woman to impersonate an executive to spy on me so that you could copy my sales technique?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. And it's the sincerest form of flattery.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Or...crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well-

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I'm gonna go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. You know what, it wasn't just me. Jim and Dwight are behind that wall in the surveillance room and it was their plan as well.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Oh, well then, yeah. All right. Hey! [knocking on wall] Good luck, guys. Seems like you got a great operation here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we don't. Here's-here's my point. Danny, listen, you have to understand that we are not normally like this. We just-we wanted to know your tricks.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: What do you mean, my tricks? There's no tricks, man. I'm just a good salesman. You wanna copy that? You can't copy that! [opens door to leave]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are, you are. You are! Stop it, stop it. Stop. [closes door] You are a good salesman. And because of that...I want you to work for me.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Sure. You seem like a fun, professional guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, you will?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: [opening door again to leave] No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hold it, hold it. [forcing door closed] Hold on, hold on. Wait, wait, wait, wait. Wait. Wait. Danny, I want you to look at me. Do you want your life to be better...or to be worse or to stay the same?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Get out of my way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Answer the question. Do you want a better life, Danny?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I swear to God, I'm gonna hit you. I didn't mean that. I'm sorry. I'm not-it's just I'm very upset right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: I'm very upset!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want more freedom, less freedom, or to stay the same?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: More freedom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can give you more money-there's your better life. I can let you come and go as you please-there's your freedom. And you already know Dunder-Mifflin has the best service and the best prices, but you beat us anyway. Can you imagine how well you would do selling our stuff?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everyone, may I have your attention? I would like to introduce you to Mr. Danny Cordray. He is going to be joining us as our new traveling salesman. Say hello to Danny!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [bleep] me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: O-kay. You know what? No. No. This is not some sort of construction site...or all of Italy, where you can just go around treating people like meat. We are to respect him. I respect him because he reminds me of somebody. Can anybody guess who that is?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Josh Duhamel.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, I can see that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. No. Somebody in this office.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He's like a better-looking Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, me. Right? Sorta like...a little younger version of me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's hard to judge ourselves accurately, isn't it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can I talk to you about something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you may not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's about this very announcement you just made.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I said no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're not-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, I think you really want to talk to him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Let's-all right, all right. Let's talk. Please don't let him leave. [pointing to Danny] Don't leave. Don't let him.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Gotcha. [they go into Michael's office]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You hired him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, let me ask you something. Do you want your life to be better or worse or stay the same?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Stay the same.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well...get ready, 'cause it's gonna get better.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's not gonna get better; he's gonna steal all of our clients.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no. Wrong. He would have stolen your clients, but you know what? He can't now. This guy used to steal sales from us; now, he's going to steal sales for us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where's he gonna sit? There's no more seats.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He doesn't need to sit, he's a traveling salesman. Look, I am not going to exclude good people from our staff simply because they are threatening to you. And unless you have a better argument than that, I suggest you leave.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hmpf!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where's he gonna park? There's no more reserved parking spots.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good-bye!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Song's about truth.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What's something you really care about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Reverse snobbery.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: More universal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sometimes I feel like life has passed me by.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [plays soft chords and sings]  Couldn't get outta bed today. Wish the alarm clock would go away.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, nice!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Holy crap. Are you kidding me? You just made that-that's amazing!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Which me am I gonna be today?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Which me am I gonna be today?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I gotta closet full of mes. Am I gonna be the happy me?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Or the me that stinks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, my gosh! We're almost out of time. How much for another half hour?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, don't worry about it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait. Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So we're just, like, jamming as friends?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: One, two, three, hit it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Closet full of mes-

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Oh, you know...funny. Your wife and I went on a few dates.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did ya?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Yeah. Way ,way, way back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm just kidding. She told me about it.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Oh. She was not into me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Obviously. I don't even think she called me back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You snubbed her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me handle this, Jim. Drop the act, Cordray, okay? We all know that you probably thought that Pam was too "meh" or thin without being toned. But I wanna tell you something-she is one of the plain hearty women of Scranton that make this city great. And so what if she doesn't wear makeup? [Pam mouthing "I wear makeup"] We like her better that way! And you steal clients, don't you? Don't you!

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Okay...that's different.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, that's different, is it? Okay...thief. You better check your things, people. In fact, where are my keys? Oh, there in my pocket. False alarm. Okay. [awkward pause] So...you're gonna be workin' here?

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Uh...I mean-yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Welcome aboard.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, crazy, um...so...that's it? You're just-you're fine?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's after 5:00, Jim. I'm not gonna take this home. [shakes Danny's hand]

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Danny
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This morning, Danny Cordray stole a sale from me. So what do I do? I go out and I steal Danny Cordray. The sale that mattered, I made. Boom. Funny thing about it, we don't even need him. We already have Packer on the road. Chhguuh! Crap. I forgot about Packer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing and playing drums] Sun's in her eyes, tongue full of flies. Would you like to share my paaaaaaad?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love. Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love and I gave her the croak that meant I love you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll be your croak monsieur.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [falsetto] I'll be your croak madame.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Your mama mighta said that bullfrogs are dogs, but I'm here to tell you that I am a frog! Come and sit on my log, you little pollywog.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I find you absolutely ribbiting!

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Croak, croak, croak. Bullfrog in love.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Croak!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ribbit!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Scoopity-splash!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice.
